in WiKi, it is said:
...
Today heritrix reads the HTTP Content-Type line parsing out any 
charset if present. This info. is used whenever an extractor goes to 
get a character stream. No attempt currently is made at using 
content-type info location such as the HTML META info. 

In heritrix, a heuristic tries to figure if the charset is single or 
multibyte. If multibyte we use an expensive charset decoding 
character stream that maps the charset to that of the JVMs. 
Otherwise we use the default treating each byte as a character. If 
the supplied charset is unknown, we fall back on treating the stream 
as single-byte. 
...

But, when I take look at the source code, I found heritrix only try 
to identify the charset from HTTP head, which is done by function 
setCharacterEncoding(.,.) in FetchHTTP.java.

am I right? 
If so, I should plug in a charset recognizer.

thanks
